summary: Max Lesnick was a Cuban exile involved in anti-Castro activities. The documents suggest he was associated with other Cuban exiles and potentially had connections to terrorist activities. He is mentioned in the context of travel plans involving AMBANG-1 and associates in 1965, and later in 1979, in cables and reports alongside Aldo Vera. The documents also place him within the broader context of Cuban exile groups and their activities, including those of Orlando Bosch and Accion Cubana. While the documents do not explicitly link Lesnick to the JFK assassination, they highlight his involvement in anti-Castro activities during a period when such groups were under scrutiny for potential involvement in the assassination.
significance: While not directly implicated in the JFK assassination in these documents, Max Lesnick's association with anti-Castro Cuban exiles, some of whom were suspected of terrorist activities, places him within a network of individuals and groups that were of interest to U.S. intelligence agencies in the aftermath of the assassination. His activities and connections were monitored due to the possibility of Cuban involvement in the assassination.
